column4: Also I would like to backup the files on my previous ubuntu install partition before I go on but when booting from the desktop cd and trying to copy from the hard drive, it says no permission
how will I get permission for the hd when booting from the cd
live cd is using a differnt user. easy way it to just use sudo/gksu and  copy the stuff as root user.
souns like a messed up menu.lst to me.
the root user has full access to all the filessytems
your phrase 'root for the cd' means nothing.
boot live cd. run file manager as root ,. mount the drives.. do what you want..
so "sudo nautilus"?
gksu normally.. if you want to use that file manager.
ok, I got it to work - how come it didn't ask for any password? i had always thought that all the data on my ext3 partition was password protected?
no its not.
if you ha encrypted the filesytem then it would be
do you have some idea how i would rewrite the grub? I've tried the directions from the ubuntuwiki but somehow the menu.lst just won't show up after the grub-install command
grub is the kind of tool it pays to read/learn its docs. at the grub homepage for sttarters. ive  played with grub so muich over theyears its not too hard. once you  learn what you are doing
if you say /boot/grub has no files - ots proberly befause you are lookin gat the cd's / (root) not the root of the hard drive.
i've re-checked - it is the directory on the hd. also, after attempting to reinstall grub, it says while booting from the hd, something like "need to load kernel first"
there's not menu.lst in the grub directory at all.
that sounds like a issue to me then.
heres my menu.lst for an example http://pastebin.com/fff9fea8
i dont think it does.. i recall the os Installer makes one.. but i dont recall any command that generated one
if you want toboot . you basiciallyneed to make one. by hand if needed
